oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Management Considerations to Control Calf Diarrhea
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Whittier, William Dee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: neonatal diarrhea
interventions
resistance
Colostrum
Immunology
Nutrition
grouping management
housing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This presentation will discuss a number of interventions believed to influence the rates of neonatal diarrhea. These actions are effective because they either increase the resistance of the calf to disease or decrease the infectious agent challenge. Included are:•Colostrum provision to calves• Steps to improve colostrum amount and quality• Immunological considerations• Nutritional considerations• Reducing exposure through housing and grouping management
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1999; 123-127
